Legal_Issue: Whether manufacturing and selling citalopram infringes Lundbeck's '368 patent
Procedural_Stage: Application to prohibit Notice of Compliance
Evidence_Assessment: Expert evidence showed citalopram treats depression but lacks substantial proof for dementia or CVD treatment
Credibility_Factor: Genpharm's intent to market only for depression
Legal_Rule: Under PM (NOC) Regulations, a generic manufacturer must prove non-infringement of listed patents
Procedural_Issue: Application under PM (NOC) Regulations to block marketing approval
Grounds_for_Claim: Lundbeck alleged potential use of citalopram for patented indications (dementia, CVD)
Outcome_on_Merits: Genpharm's allegation of non-infringement was justified
Review_Standard: Evaluation of whether allegations are evidence-based
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Genpharm had opportunity to present evidence of intended use
Key_Evidence_Considered: Expert testimony on therapeutic uses of citalopram
Legal_Framework: Regulatory framework for drug approval and patent linkage under PM (NOC) Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Genpharm challenged the enforceability of Lundbeck's patent in relation to its product
Court_Result: Allowed Genpharm to proceed without proving non-infringement definitively
Defendant_Response: Genpharm claimed its product is indicated solely for depression, not for dementia or CVD
Remedy_Requested: Lundbeck requested prohibition of Notice of Compliance
Outcome: Request denied; Genpharm permitted to obtain Notice of Compliance
Remedy_Sought: Interim injunction to prevent market entry until patent expiry
Legal_Provision: Section of PM (NOC) Regulations regarding patent listing and certification
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation of potential off-label use not sufficient to prove infringement
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application to prohibit issuance of NOC
